summary.para: Gets the required number of bytes that need to be prepended to the input and output buffers when you call the security processor through the method. When you specify this number of bytes, the Media Foundation transform (MFT) decryptor can allocate the total amount of bytes and can avoid making copies of the data when the decryptor moves the data to the security processor.

param.name: PrivateInputByteCount
param.para: The required number of bytes that need to be prepended to the input buffer that you supply to content protection system.

param.name: PrivateOutputByteCount
param.para: The required number of bytes that need to be prepended to the output buffer that you supply to content protection system.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Calls into the implementation of the protection system in the security processor.

param.name: FunctionId
param.para: The identifier of the function that you want to run. This identifier is defined by the implementation of the protection system.

param.name: InputBufferByteCount
param.para: The number of bytes of in the buffer that InputBuffer specifies, including private data.

param.name: InputBuffer
param.para: A pointer to the data that you want to provide as input.

param.name: OutputBufferByteCount
param.para: Pointer to a value that specifies the length in bytes of the data that the function wrote to the buffer that OutputBuffer specifies, including the private data.

param.name: OutputBuffer
param.para: Pointer to the buffer where you want the function to write its output.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Allows a decryptor to communicate with the security processor that implements the hardware decryption for a protection system.
